info.name: FlyNext: your most reliable travel companion!
info.description:
List of APIs provided by **FlyNext (FN).**

The FlyNext API provides RESTful endpoints for users to search for flights, book travel itineraries (including flights and hotels), and manage bookings, and for hotel owners to signup and manage thir hotels bookings. It also includes auxiliary APIs for retrieving booking details, listing cities, airports.

### **Key Features:**

- **User Accounts**: Sign up, log in, log out, and manage user profiles with JWT-based authentication.
    
- **Flight Search**: Search for one-way and round-trip flights based on source, destination (city/airport), and date(s). View flight details, including departure/arrival times, duration, and layovers.
    
- **Hotel Management**: Hotel owners can add and manage hotels, define room types, track bookings, cancel orders and view availability.
    
- **Hotel Search**: Users can search hotels by date, city, star rating, and price range, viewing available room details.
    
- **Booking System**: Users can book flights and hotels, view booking details, cancel reservations, and receive invoices.
    
- **Notifications**: Users and hotel owners receive updates on booking confirmations, cancellations.

item.name: Users
status

request.description:
This API endpoint is used for user authentication.

input: email, password

return: an access token stored in cookies.

The user provides their email and password, and if the credentials are valid, the server generates and returns an access token, which can be used for future authenticated requests. The response also includes basic user information such as id, firstName, and lastName.

header.value: accessToken=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZCI6Miwicm9sZSI6IkhPVEVMX09XTkVSIiwiaWF0IjoxNzQxNDY3NTA4LCJleHAiOjE3NDE0ODU1MDh9.W_ddQVHW-wfsUFf0Esqewkf7rXBWgz0UAEpAP0eRXM0; Path=/; Expires=Sat, 15 Mar 2025 20:58:28 GMT; Max-Age=604800; HttpOnly

request.description:
return: message indicating success/failure of logging out

This API endpoint is used to log out a user by invalidating their active session. The user must provide a valid access token in the request header. Once the request is successfully processed, the server will remove or invalidate the access token, effectively logging out the user and ensuring they no longer have access to protected resources.

header.description: mock user login. Should only have this cookie after user signup/login

item.description: Deal with user login or logout.

request.description:
input: email, password, firstName, lastName, phoneNumber

return: message whether or not signing up is successful, on success, returns user id and userRole

This endpoint is used to create a new user account by providing the necessary details such as email, password, first name, last name, phone number, and user role. Depending on the provided role (`HOTEL_OWNER` or `REGULAR_USER`), the user will be assigned the appropriate privileges.

header.value: accessToken=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZCI6Mywicm9sZSI6IlJFR1VMQVJfVVNFUiIsImlhdCI6MTc0MTQ2NzQwNiwiZXhwIjoxNzQxNDg1NDA2fQ.Y-7GCJc-0Q8AYk1mgzN0c7tHpAUaoWqw6W4rkscXgd4; Path=/; Expires=Sat, 15 Mar 2025 20:56:46 GMT; Max-Age=604800; HttpOnly

accessToken=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZCI6NSwicm9sZSI6IkhPVEVMX09XTkVSIiwiaWF0IjoxNzQxNDcyNDc5LCJleHAiOjE3NDE0OTA0Nzl9.99nHnkaN7m6nxkIIrQVRpyI0OIwCgTNqWIgBhn5o8vM; Path=/; Expires=Sat, 15 Mar 2025 22:21:19 GMT; Max-Age=604800; HttpOnly

request.description:
input: no parameter needed. uses the JWT token stored in cookie to specify user.

This API endpoint is used to retrieve the account information of the authenticated user. The user must be logged in, and the request must include a valid JWT token in the `Authorization` header.

input: json of the field that user wants to update.

Fields that could be updated: `firstName`, `lastName`,`email, phoneNumber, profilePicture`

This API endpoint allows the authenticated user to update their profile information. The request must include a valid JWT token in the `Authorization` header. Users can modify their profile details like `firstName`, `lastName`, `phoneNumber`, etc.

item.description: Deal with user signup, login, logout, get account infomation, and update profile.

item.name: Flights

query.description: can either be city or airport code, city must in Title case.
can either be city or airport code, airport code must all in CAPITAL case.
must have 2 dates if it's round trip. Otherwise only one date.
optional parm. Value must be true or false, case insensitive.

request.description:
input: origin, destination, date, round

return: list of flights that flys from origin to destination.

response.name: Get flight

query.description: can either be city or airport code, city must in Title case.
can either be city or airport code, airport code must all in CAPITAL case.

can either ignore this param, or set false. 
value must be true or false, case insensitive.

item.description: Search for the flights that meets up user's request.

query.description: case sensitive, must be in Title Case.

request.description: Auto-complete the ciy that the user is inputing. Also provides the airports of that city.
This API endpoint is used to create a new room for a specific hotel. The request allows you to specify the room type, amenities, price per night, and associated images for the room.

This API endpoint allows users to filter available rooms at a specific hotel within a given date range. The request returns a list of rooms with details such as availability, price, and amenities during the specified time period.

request.description:
This method allows cancellation of booking by hotel owner.

Input: booking id.

Output: message indicating how the cancellation went.

This API endpoint allows users to cancel an existing booking by specifying the booking ID and the hotel ID. The request will update the status of the booking, marking it as cancelled.

This API endpoint retrieves the list of bookings for a specific hotel. You can filter the bookings based on parameters such as room type and date.

input: roomType and/or date.

return: booking details that satisfy the criteria

This is useful for viewing the reservation details and tracking bookings for specific rooms.

This API endpoint allows the creation of a new hotel.

input: The hotel details such as name, logo, address, city, star rating, and images.

return: message whether or not successful creating hotel and hotel details

It ensures the hotel is added to the system and returns the created hotel information.

item.name: Bookings
Checkout

request.description:
This endpoint is used for validating payment for booking and finalizing a booking (actually perform the booking on AFS and hotel room management).

Input: payment card information, booking information, passport number (optional).

Output: updated booking information.

Inputs card information, booking information that we can get from create booking and update booking, and passport number if the booking includes flight.

The return value would be the updated booking information, with status CONFIRMED and booking reference and ticket number if the booking includes flight.

This method returns the full booking details of the pending booking during checkout.

Input: booking id.

Output: booking information.

  
The parameters include a unique booking id, based on the id we can view detailed information of the booking. Meant for the user to view on frontend during checkout.

item.description: Endpoint for user to checkout their currently pending booking (each user can only have 1 pending booking at a time). If the checkout is successful, then the booking would change to be confirmed and retrievable in records.

request.description:
Finds flight/hotel suggestions for pending booking.

Input: itinerary, flight destination (optional), origin (optional), destination (optional), date.

Output: json of flights suggested or json of hotels suggested.

The url parameters provide information about the type of itinerary the current pending booking has, which is always required. The flight destination and date is provided if booking has flight and need suggestion for hotels. If the booking has hotel, the hotel, origin, destination, and date must be provided for search of flight suggestions.

The response should be information of suggested flights or information of suggested hotel, depending on which itinerary was given, the user may choose which suggestion they take in frontend and get redirect to filter page using the response information. If itinerary shows pending booking already has flight and hotel, then no suggestion would be given.

request.description:
This creates a new booking if the user haven't started creating one or have finished all their booking's checkout.

Input: itinerary of booking, flights to book, hotel to book.

Output: created booking information.

The request should include the itinerary type of the booking and the flight(s) or hotel details to make the booking. The response would be the booking information created if request is formated correctly.

response.name: Create Flight Booking
response.body:
{
    "id": 4,
    "userId": 1,
    "itinerary": "FLIGHT_ROUNDTRIP",
    "hotelCost": null,
    "checkIn": null,
    "checkOut": null,
    "roomId": null,
    "bookRef": null,
    "ticketNum": null,
    "status": "PENDING",
    "createdAt": "2025-03-08T15:01:44.164Z",
    "updatedAt": "2025-03-08T15:01:44.164Z"
}

request.description:
Updates a pending booking adding flight or adding/switching hotel.

Input: booking id, flights to add, and hotel to add/switch to.

The request would be a json of id of booking to update booking, addFlights or addHotel at least one of them should not be empty. They contain the new flight(s) or new hotel to update the pending booking to include. This method is usually triggered when a person chooses flight(s) or hotel but they have a pending booking, so they would be directed to this method.

Only one hotel could be in a booking, so the original hotel would be overwritten if there was already a hotel in the booking. There's no limit to the number of flight to book.

Get booking information of currently pending booking for user to view.

Input: booking id in url.

Output: booking information.

The parameter includes a booking id to get the corresponding booking information as response. For user to view the booking they have currently pending.

item.description: Endpoint where all bookings happen, from creating booking, to getting suggestions, updating pending booking, and checkout booking. Implements Booking user story 1-3

item.name: Records
[id]
Verify
Verify Booking and Flight Status by Id

request.description:
Gets flight booking status.

Input: booking id in url.

Output: status of flight booking, flight ids of flights booked, flight status of flights booked.

The url tells information about which booking we need to check flight status. The output would be the booking status, the flightIds of the flights booked, and their status. The flightStatus at the nth index would correspond to the status of the flight with id at nth index of flightId.

item.description: Endpoint to verify the flight booking status of booking. Designed to only be accessible by bookings with a flight (needs implementation in frontend to achieve this).

item.name: Invoice

request.description:
Get information to generate a minimal pdf invoice for the booking.

Input: booking id in url.

Output: invoice information to be displayed in pdf invoice (created on frontend).

  
Based on the id in url, the information of the invoice with the corresponding booking id would be in the response.

The currency here indicates the currency of hotel and/or flights. The hotel's cost currency goes first, then the flights' currency in the order of how the flights are stored in booking.

item.description: Endpoint to check the invoice of a booking

request.description:
Cancel completed booking or cancel parts of booking.

Input: booking id in url, type of cancellation in cancelType, the flight ids of flight to cancel in cancelFlight, and boolean cancelHotel to determine whether hotel should be cancelled.

Output: booking information after cancel.

Based on the booking id in url and the json request, we cancel the entire booking or parts of booking, indicated by cancelType ("ALL" or "PARTIAL").

The cancelHotel is used to indicate whether we cancel the hotel or not, and cancelFlight is used to indicate the flight(s) to cancel with a list of flight ids. If we cancel everything, we need to include the cancelHotel (normally we need to include cancelFlight as well, but it was said that flight cancellation is not required for PP1 so it was taken off for simplicity). Partial cancellation only allows hotel cancellation for now.

The response is the updated booking information.

Get booking details of booking with specific id.

Input: booking id in url.

Output: detailed booking information.

The url with booking id indicates the booking information to retrieve as response. The response would be a detailed booking information with flight information and room and hotel information of the booking.

response.name: Get Booking Detail of Id 3

item.description: Endpoint with specific booking id to perform the user story 4-7 functionality on specific booking.

request.description:
Get list of bookings that are CONFIRMED or CANCELED (paid or cancelled).

Input: user id saved in request.

Output: all bookings the user has paid or paid then cancelled.

In the records endpoint, we get a list of bookings with minimal information of the booking. Only for display purposes and provide user the choice to see a specific booking and see invoice, verify flight status, etc.

item.description: Includes the functionality to show completed or cancelled booking to user, cancel/partial cancel booking, get invoice information, and verify flight booking status. Implemented Booking user story 4-7.

item.name: Notifications
[nid]

request.description: Mark the notification as read.

response.name: Mark as read

item.description: Endpoint where a specific notification is viewed.

query.description: optional, value must be true or false, case insensitive

request.description:
return the whole notification list,

or filter the unread notifications only, if parameter `unreadOnly` is true.

response.name: Get all notifications
